info.title: Credential Theft
info.description: This quiz tests your knowledge on credential theft, phishing attacks and protecting against account takeovers.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of credential theft?
options: To send spam emails
To gain unauthorized access to accounts
To install software updates
To improve account security
questions.answer: To gain unauthorized access to accounts

questions.question: What is the most secure way to protect your accounts from credential theft?
options: Using the same password across multiple accounts
Only changing passwords every 5 years
Enabling Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Clicking on all password reset links received via email

questions.question: Which of the following is a clear sign of a phishing attempt?
options: An email from HR asking for feedback on a survey
A message saying: 'Urgent: Your account will be locked! Click here to verify your details now.'
A notification from your bank asking you to update your app
A reminder from IT to change your password every 3 months
questions.answer: A message saying: 'Urgent: Your account will be locked! Click here to verify your details now.'

questions.question: What should you do if you receive a suspicious login request via email?
options: Click the link immediately and enter your credentials
Ignore it and do nothing
Go to the official website directly and check for any security alerts
Forward the email to all coworkers for their opinion
questions.answer: Go to the official website directly and check for any security alerts

questions.question: What is an Account Takeover attack?
options: A hacker guessing random passwords
When an attacker successfully logs into an account using stolen credentials
A software update that locks users out
A company policy requiring employees to reset passwords
questions.answer: When an attacker successfully logs into an account using stolen credentials
